item.title: MACD - Moving Average Convergence Divergence
item.description: About The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) is a versatile trading indicator used in various forms of trading, including high-frequency trading (HFT). MACD is a trend-following momentum indicator that shows the relationship between two moving averages of a securityâ€™s price. Calculating Formula The MACD is calculated by subtracting the 26-period Exponential Moving Average (EMA) from the 12-period EMA. A 9-day EMA of the MACD, called the “signal line”, is then plotted on top of the MACD, functioning as a trigger for buy and sell signals.
